qas.question: The methods kennel clubs used to classify dogs is what?
A scientific study of dog genetics has shown only how many  types of dogs being determinably distinct?
What, according to the text, are two examples of "old world" dogs?
the Border collie is an example of what type of dog?
How many main types of dogs are there?
What type of dogs are Shar Peis?
What are the other modern and hunting types of dogs called?

context: Purebred dogs of one breed are genetically distinguishable from purebred dogs of other breeds, but the means by which kennel clubs classify dogs is <a0_0>unsystematic.<a0_0/> Systematic analyses of the dog genome has revealed only <a1_0><a4_0>four<a4_0/><a1_0/> major types of dogs that can be said to be statistically distinct. These include the "<a5_0>old world dogs<a5_0/>" (e.g., <a2_0>Malamute and Shar Pei<a2_0/>), "Mastiff"-type (e.g., English Mastiff), "<a3_0>herding<a3_0/>"-type (e.g., Border Collie), and "<a6_0>all others<a6_0/>" (also called "modern"- or "hunting"-type).
